Basis Technology Corp. is a software company with headquarters in Cambridge, Massachusetts. The company also has offices in San Francisco, Washington DC, and Japan.
The company, founded in 1995, is best known for its Rosette Linguistics Platform, which uses Natural Language Processing techniques to improve information retrieval, text mining and other applications. Rosette provides capabilities like identifying the language of incoming text, providing a normalized representation in Unicode, and locating names, places and other key concepts from a body of unstructured text.1
Since 2001 the company has specialized in text extraction technology to assist the US Government.2
